Class: Client

Client

Construct a Client using an AccessManager to create and participate in Conversations.

AccessManager is provided by twilio-common.js, which must be included alongside twilio-conversations.js.

Constructor

new Twilio.Conversations.Client(accessManager, optionsopt)

Constructs a new Client with an AccessManager.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
accessManager AccessManager

The Client's AccessManager
options Client#ClientOptions <optional>

Options to override the constructor's default behavior
Properties:
Name Type Description
accessManager AccessManager

The Client's AccessManager
identity string

The Client's identity
conversations Set.<Conversation>

The Conversations this Client is active in
isListening bool

Whether the Client is listening for Invites to Conversations
invites Set.<Invite>

The active Invites this Client has received
Source:
  • client.js, line 41
Fires:
  • Client#event:invite
  • Client#event:error
  • Client#event:tokenExpired

Methods

createConversation(participants, optionsopt) → {CancelablePromise.<Conversation>}

Invite remote Clients to join a Conversation.

By default, this will attempt to setup an AudioTrack and VideoTrack between local and remote Clients. You can override this by specifying options.

You can call .cancel() on the returned CancelablePromise until the remote Client has joined.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
participants Array.<string> | string

Participant(s) to invite to the Conversation
options Client#CreateConversationOptions <optional>
 {localStreamConstraints:{audio:true,video:true}}

Options to override Client#createConversation's default behavior
Source:
  • client.js, line 326
Returns:
Type
CancelablePromise.<Conversation>
Example
var initialToken = getAccessToken();
var manager = new Twilio.AccessManager(initialToken);
var client = new Twilio.Conversations.Client(manager);

client.createConversation(['bob', 'charlie']).then(function(conversation) {
  conversation.on('participantConnected', function(participant) {
    console.log(participant.identity + ' has connected');
  });
});

listen() → {Promise.<Client>}

Causes this Client to start listening for Invites to Conversations.

Source:
  • client.js, line 272
Returns:
Type
Promise.<Client>
Example
var initialToken = getAccessToken();
var manager = new Twilio.AccessManager(initialToken);
var alice = new Twilio.Conversations.Client(manager);

alice.listen().then(function() {
  console.log('Alice is listening');
}, function(error) {
  console.error(error);
});

unlisten() → {Promise.<Client>}

Causes this Client to stop listening for Invites to Conversations until Client#listen is called again.

Source:
  • client.js, line 241
Returns:
Type
Promise.<Client>

Type Definitions

ClientOptions

You may pass these options to Client's constructor to override its default behavior.

Type:
  • object
Properties:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
logLevel string <optional>
 'warn'

Set the verbosity of logging to console. Valid values: ['off', 'error', 'warn', 'info', 'debug']
Source:
  • client.js, line 522

CreateConversationOptions

You may pass these options to Client#createConversation to override the default behavior.

Type:
  • object
Properties:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
localMedia LocalMedia <optional>
<nullable>
 null

Set to reuse an existing LocalMedia object when creating the Conversation
localStream MediaStream <optional>
<nullable>
 null

Set to reuse an existing MediaStream when creating the Conversation
localStreamConstraints object <optional>
<nullable>
 {audio:true,video:true}

Set to override the parameters passed to getUserMedia when neither localMedia nor localStream are provided
Source:
  • client.js, line 530

Events

error

Your Client has run into an error.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
error Error

The Error
Source:
  • client.js, line 477
Example
var initialToken = getAccessToken();
var manager = new Twilio.AccessManager(initialToken);
var client = new Twilio.Conversations.Client(manager);

client.on('error', function(error) {
 console.error(error);
});

invite

Your Client has received an Invite to participant in a Conversation.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
invite Invite

the Invite
Source:
  • client.js, line 491
Example
var initialToken = getAccessToken();
var manager = new Twilio.AccessManager(initialToken);
var client = new Twilio.Conversations.Client(manager);

client.on('invite', function(invite) {
  console.log('Received an Invite to join a Conversation from ' + invite.from);
});

tokenExpired

Your Client's AccessManager's Access Token has expired. You should update the Access Token on the AccessManager.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
accessManager AccessManager
Source:
  • client.js, line 506
Example
var initialToken = getAccessToken();
var manager = new Twilio.AccessManager(initialToken);
var client = new Twilio.Conversations.Client(manager);

client.on('tokenExpired', function() {
  var newToken = getAccessToken();
  manager.updateToken(newToken);
});
